title.narrative: Emergency Response to Displacement Affected Communities

description.narrative: As other settlements have been filled, new refugees arriving from South Sudan are being settled in the Imvepi settlement of Arua District. Due to mass influx, basic needs such as food supply, water supply, and sanitation and education services constitute the emergency needs to address. An integrated approach will be used for this action to ensure synergies between all results of the action (WaSH, Education and Protection) to maximize benefits to the beneficiaries. Action Against Hunger will lead in the provision of WaSH services while NRC will take lead in provision of Education in emergencies and IRC takes the lead in Protection—all based on the technical specialties of the consortium partners.

In the WaSH sector, interventions will increase the drinkable water supply, provide beneficiaries with adapted sanitary facilities such as latrines, address hygiene behavior in the community and schools, and ensure the minimum WaSH package in health facilities. The intervention will build the capacity of existing health systems in terms of WaSH management, contributing to the reduction of malnutrition. In education, The Accelerated Education Approach will target over-age primary-level children (9-17 years) and offering an opportunity to complete primary education and transit to post-primary education or the formal school system at the appropriate age. The project will construct classrooms, recruit teachers, provide desks and textbooks, and train teachers in the concept of education in emergencies. Finally, in the protection sector, IRC will strengthen the protection and empowerment of women and girls through case management, psychosocial services and empowerment activities. IRC will focus on improving and building the capacity of local GBV actors (women, parent/caregivers, and men).
